intro: Securidaca dolod, commonly known as the African Sweetscent, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often emitting a sweet fragrance. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Securidaca dolod is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its pleasant scent and delicate appearance.
